mdRecord.dcterms:title: Lippitt Mill, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Sited near Main Street is the original building on the site, the Number One Mill. It is a three and one-half story, wood-shingled structure, 34 feet wide and 104 feet deep, with a clerestory monitor in its end-gable roof and a short, square tower at the front topped by an octagonal cupola. --http://www.pvhistorian.com/lippittmill.html. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
